item.title: Malaika Arora Feels 'Energised With The Winter Sun': 6 Health Benefits Of Sunbathing - TheHealthSite
item.description:
Malaika Arora Feels 'Energised With The Winter Sun': 6 Health Benefits Of Sunbathing

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Health Site

Malaika Arora emphasizes the importance of moderate sun exposure during winter, sharing how it can be beneficial for health. She believes that basking in sunlight not only energizes but also promotes overall well-being.

  • Boosts vitamin D levels, essential for bone health.
  • Reduces seasonal affective disorder (SAD) and improves mood.
  • Supports circadian rhythm, enhancing sleep quality and energy levels.
  • Improves skin health by promoting collagen production.
  • Increases energy and alertness, combating fatigue.
  • Supports immune function, aiding in fighting infections.
"Energised with the winter sun," - Malaika Arora

In conclusion, embracing the winter sun can have various health benefits, making it a valuable practice for enhancing physical and mental well-being.

item.title: L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan paid ₹51 crore as salary in FY24, while median salary of employees was… - Hindustan Times
item.description:
L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan's ₹51 Crore Salary Sparks Outrage

Published on: Jan 10, 2025 | Source: The New Indian Express

Larsen & Toubro chairman SN Subrahmanyan earned a total salary of ₹51 crore in FY24, which is 534.57 times the median salary of employees at the company.

  • Subrahmanyan's remuneration included a base salary of ₹3.6 crore, ₹1.67 crore in prerequisites, and ₹35.28 crore in commission.
  • His retirement benefits totaled ₹10.5 crore.
  • He is facing backlash for suggesting employees work 90 hours a week.
  • His comments have been criticized by celebrities and social media users, highlighting the disparity between his salary and that of average employees.
  • The median salary for L&T employees was ₹9.55 lakh in FY24, compared to Subrahmanyan's ₹51 crore.
  • His salary increased by 43.11% from the previous year.
  • L&T defended his remarks by stating that extraordinary outcomes require extraordinary efforts.
“If I can make you work on Sundays, I will be more happy, because I work on Sundays.” - SN Subrahmanyan

The salary disparity and Subrahmanyan's remarks raise significant questions about work-life balance and corporate culture at L&T.

item.title: 'Gautam Gambhir abused my family, said...': Why 'PR-protected' India head coach was called 'hypocrite', Tiwary reveals - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘Gautam Gambhir abused my family, said...’: Why 'PR-protected' India head coach was called 'hypocrite', Tiwary reveals

Publication Date: [Insert Date] | Source: Hindustan Times

Former cricketer Manoj Tiwary has openly criticized current Indian head coach Gautam Gambhir, highlighting the poor performance of the team and questioning Gambhir’s coaching experience.

  • Team India has lost six out of their last eight Tests, failing to qualify for the World Test Championship final for the first time.
  • Tiwary emphasizes that Gambhir's coaching lacks experience and results.
  • He labels Gambhir a "hypocrite" for employing foreign coaches despite previously denouncing foreign coaching in India.
“When you lose three series in your short tenure ... that is purely due to lack of experience in coaching,” said Tiwary.

In conclusion, Tiwary calls for improvements in Gambhir's coaching methods and expresses concern about the selection process within the team.

item.title: Localities look ‘bombed’, houses charred: Aftermath of California wildfires as seen from above - Hindustan Times
item.description:
California Wildfires Cause Devastation as Flames Rage On

Publication Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The wildfires that have been raging in Southern California have left devastation in their wake, with areas resembling a war zone. Despite the continuous efforts of firefighters, the blazes remain out of control.

  • Wildfires have been ongoing in the Los Angeles area since January 10, 2025.
  • Many neighborhoods have been completely destroyed, with only the outlines of roads visible.
  • The situation has led authorities to issue mandatory evacuation orders.
  • Local residents returning home found their properties reduced to ashes.
  • Another fire, known as the “Kenneth Fire,” has emerged in the region, compounding the crisis.
“The Los Angeles Fire Department is issuing a Mandatory Evacuation Order for an immediate evacuation order for all residents within this area.”

This latest round of wildfires showcases the ongoing challenges California faces regarding fire safety and disaster management.

item.title: India Star Comes Out In Support Of Gautam Gambhir, Slams Critics With "Personal Insecurities" Remark.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Harshit Rana Supports Gautam Gambhir Amid Criticism

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

India pacer Harshit Rana has publicly defended head coach Gautam Gambhir amid criticism following India's loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia. As fans and former players expressed their dissatisfaction, Rana emphasized Gambhir's support for players.

  • Gautam Gambhir faced backlash after India's 1-3 series loss to Australia.
  • Harshit Rana backed Gambhir, stating that criticizing him due to personal insecurities is wrong.
  • Nitish Rana also supported Gambhir, praising his selflessness.
  • The article discusses India's performance in the ODI series against Sri Lanka and subsequent matches.
  • Gambhir's coaching tenure faced challenges with significant losses against New Zealand and Australia.
“Criticising someone due to personal insecurities is not good. Gauti bhaiya is someone who thinks more for others than himself.” - Harshit Rana

The support for Gambhir highlights the desire for constructive criticism rather than personal attacks, amidst the scrutiny following a challenging series for the Indian cricket team.

item.title: "Suryakumar Yadav Isn't There But Shreyas Iyer...": Ex-India Star's Big Champions Trophy Revelation - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Aakash Chopra Reveals Champions Trophy Squad Exclusion for Suryakumar Yadav

Published on: 12 October 2024   Source: NDTV

Aakash Chopra, former Indian cricketer, provides insights about the upcoming Champions Trophy 2025 squad, highlighting key omissions and selections.

  • Aakash Chopra believes Suryakumar Yadav and Sanju Samson will be left out of the Champions Trophy squad due to lack of performances.
  • Chopra emphasizes Shreyas Iyer’s strong form, stating he has scored 620 runs in 15 innings since the World Cup.
  • He defends Hardik Pandya's inclusion, citing his active participation in recent tournaments.
  • Chopra lists his predicted Champions Trophy squad for India.
“Suryakumar Yadav isn't there but Shreyas Iyer is. Since the start of the World Cup, he has scored 620 runs in 15 innings, with two centuries.” - Aakash Chopra

The analysis sheds light on the dynamics of team selection ahead of a significant international tournament, predicting shifts based on current form and recent performances.

item.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade - Moneycontrol
item.description:
First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The GIFT Nifty is trading lower, indicating a negative start for the day. Asian equities and US futures fell as caution took hold ahead of jobs data that will help shape the outlook for Federal Reserve interest rates.

  • Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty 50 are likely to open on a negative note.
  • The GIFT Nifty is trading around 23,586.50.
  • Nifty finished below 23,550 amid selling across sectors except FMCG.
  • At close, the Sensex was down 528.28 points (0.68%) at 77,620.21.
  • The Nifty was down 162.45 points (0.69%) at 23,526.50.
Hope you're all set for today's trade, we wish you a profitable day ahead.

Investors and traders should brace for a cautious trading day influenced by the prevailing global cues and employment data insights.

item.title: Dense Fog Envelops Delhi-NCR Again, AQI Drops To "Severe" Category - NDTV
item.description:
Dense Fog Envelops Delhi-NCR Again, AQI Drops To "Severe" Category

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Dense fog has enveloped parts of the Delhi-NCR region this morning, drastically reducing visibility and impacting flight and train operations.

  • Flight delays averaged 41 minutes with over 20 trains also delayed.
  • The Delhi International Airport reported the situation impacted flight departures.
  • The AQI of Delhi was recorded at 408, categorizing air quality as 'severe'.
  • Stage 3 curbs under the Graded Response Action Plan have been re-implemented due to rising pollution levels.
“Hundreds of flights and trains have been cancelled or delayed due to thick fog in the past few weeks.”

The air quality index is a significant indicator of pollution in the region, and current conditions have prompted immediate action from authorities.

item.title: First HMPV case in elderly reported in India amid China's recent surge - Business Standard
item.description:
First HMPV Case in Elderly Reported in India Amid China's Recent Surge

Publication Date: Recent Report, Source: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation

This article discusses the first reported case of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) in an elderly man in India, following a recent outbreak in China. The patient is currently in stable condition and receiving treatment.

  • An 80-year-old man detected with HMPV infection in Ahmedabad.
  • First instance of elderly infection since the outbreak in China.
  • The patient has no travel history abroad.
  • Condition is stable; he has a history of asthma.
  • HMPV typically causes mild respiratory symptoms; most recover without treatment.
  • Monitoring and preventive measures are in place by the central government.
The virus infection is usually mild and self-limiting and most people recover on their own.

The detection of HMPV in this elderly patient underscores the importance of continued surveillance and awareness regarding respiratory infections.

item.title: California wildfires: ‘Apocalyptic’ fires continue, over 4,000 structures gone; toll likely to rise | 10 points - Hindustan Times
item.description:
California wildfires: ‘Apocalyptic’ fires continue, over 4,000 structures gone; toll likely to rise

Date: Jan 10, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The wildfires in California have devastated the Los Angeles area, resulting in at least five fatalities and the destruction of over 4,000 structures. Firefighters are battling these blazes, hoping to gain control as winds lessen.

  • A new fire near West Hills has caused additional evacuations.
  • A curfew in heavily impacted areas is planned from 6 PM Thursday to 6 AM Friday.
  • Los Angeles County officials are focusing evacuation efforts on severely affected regions.
  • Over 4,000 structures have been reported destroyed, impacting homes and businesses.
  • President Biden termed these fires the worst in LA history and approved federal aid.
  • FEMA will assess damage based on recommendations from local officials.
  • The NBA postponed the Lakers' game due to fire-related disruptions.
  • Fires in Pasadena, Eaton, and Sunset remain active with only minor containment efforts.
  • The death toll is expected to rise, with ongoing assessments.
  • Powerful Santa Ana winds have fueled the fires since Tuesday.
“These are the worst fires ever to hit Los Angeles.” – President Joe Biden

The wildfires are a severe crisis impacting both the immediate community and broader society, raising concerns over safety, infrastructure, and disaster response effectiveness.

item.title: Small investments surge as new wave of angel investors enters startup scene, seeking lucrative returns | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Small investments surge as new wave of angel investors enters startup scene, seeking lucrative returns

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Company Business News

Investments starting from ₹50,000 are witnessing a significant increase in India's startup ecosystem, driven by a new demographic of angel investors eager for profitable opportunities.

  • New-age angel investors are making micro-investments typically starting at ₹50,000.
  • Angel investor cheques predominantly range between ₹3 lakh and ₹8 lakh.
  • This trend indicates a significant shift towards smaller investment amounts as compared to traditional investing patterns.
"The rising incomes and fear of missing out on lucrative deals are key drivers behind this surge in angel investments."

This movement suggests a broader transformation in how investment is approached within India's vibrant startup scene, pointing towards an inclusive financial landscape.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 family might arrive with an unwelcome price hike - GSMArena.com
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 family might arrive with an unwelcome price hike

Publication Date: January 22

Source: GSMArena

Samsung is set to unveil the Galaxy S25 family on January 22, and pricing details have surfaced from an Italian retailer, suggesting a potential price increase.

  • The S25 is purportedly priced at €973 for 128GB, €1,036 for 256GB, and €1,162 for 512GB.
  • The S25+ may come in at €1,246 for 256GB and €1,371 for 512GB.
  • The S25 Ultra is rumored to be priced at €1,571 for 256GB, €1,696 for 512GB, and €1,948 for 1TB.
“If we round all of these prices up to the nearest hundred euros, then it seems like Europe is in for a €100 price hike across the board.”

This pricing information might simply be speculative and not verified, with the Galaxy S25 Slim expected to release sometime later.
